title: If a user is asked by the owner for their shared addresses and they have none set up, we should prompt the user

labels.name: E:Desktop Tokenized Ownership
labels.description: Implementation of the tokenization of community ownership and transfer of said ownership

labels.name: E:Desktop Community Shared Addresses Selection
labels.description: Implementation of the Shared Addresses feature for joining communities and also for edits

milestone.description:
**1. Finish anything that wasn't completed in the previous 0.15 cycle**

- And fix bugs as usual.  We need to keep tech. debt at a roughly fixed level as we grow out functionality, can't let it accumulate! ;-)

**2. Sending tokens to other users in chat**
- Rebuild this functionality, based on a new design that utilizes the profile showcase functionality

**3. Complete initial airdrop functionality**
- Airdrop history screens
- Ability to airdrop based on in-Community activity (No. of msg, No. msg in time range, joining a community, length of community membership)  Ability to combine multiple attributes into an airdrop
- Ability to token gate airdrops
- Live airdrop gas estimation when setting up airdrop

**4. Community Admin functionality enhancements**
- optional service to once a month auto-kick all members who haven't been online for between 30 and 60 days (e.g. auto-kick members whose profile information like Name, Avatar, etc... can no longer be fetched)

**5. QR scanner**
- Needed for private key transfer
- Ethereum key QRs (send modal triggered)
- User Share URL in a QR (opens user profile dialogue) 
- Community and Channel inside Community URL in QRs (takes user to Community or Channel in Community)

**6. Chat functionality enhancements**
- Introduce @channel as a new type of global @ mention.  This @ mention only @ mention's everyone who has posted a message in a channel in the last 30 days 
- Introduce the ability to search the users in the right side members/users bar.  At the same time, make any adaptations needed so that the right side members/users bar can scale to 10,000 users.

**7. Telegram history import into a single channel in an existing community**


**--- Wallet Team ---**

1. WalletConnect 2.0 support

2. Total balance graphs for 'All accounts' and each individual account

3. Advanced transaction signing

body:
### Description

Dependent on https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/11969

In the above issue, the owner node will ask the users' nodes what their shared addresses are (all in the background). It,s possible however that the user never shared them (very old account), or more probable, they lost their account and re-imported.

If that's the case, when the user's node gets the signal to get the shared addresses, the app should add a notification of some sort asking to select the shared addresses.

I propose a notification in the activity center, but I'll leave it up to designers.

Once that prompt/notification is clicked by the user, it should make them go to the "edit shared addresses" modal, which will send the shared addresses correctly to the owner

### Acceptance Criteria

- There is a prompt/notification that is shown to users that have no shared addresses in their DB for a specific community when asked by the owner
- When clicked, that prompt goes to the edit shared addresses modal
